security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing architectural guidance for ChatKit chatbot development. No executable code, network calls, or file system access beyond reading its own documentation files. Code examples demonstrate standard security patterns including JWT authentication middleware, user isolation strategies, and API authentication flows.

content.value_statement: Building ChatKit chatbots requires integrating multiple technologies (FastAPI, OpenAI Agents SDK, MCP tools) with proper security patterns. This skill provides complete architectural guidance for creating production-ready chatbots with user isolation and real-time capabilities.
actual_capabilities: Create FastAPI backend with ChatKit server implementation
Build JWT authentication middleware for user isolation
Integrate OpenAI Agents SDK with MCP tool wrappers
Configure Next.js frontend with ChatKit widget
Implement three-level user isolation (middleware, tool, database)
Add real-time synchronization between chat and dashboard
limitations: Skill provides guidance only - requires implementation effort
Does not include pre-built backend or frontend code
Requires separate OpenAI API key and ChatKit access
Database and deployment setup is not included

output_examples.input: Help me set up a ChatKit server with user isolation
output: 4. Create tool wrappers that capture user_id in closure
6. Add user_id filter to all database queries
7. Configure ChatKit endpoint in FastAPI router

best_practices: Always filter database queries by user_id at the database level
Create tool wrappers inside the respond() method to capture user_id in closure
Validate JWT tokens in middleware before processing any requests
anti_patterns: Defining wrappers outside respond() causing shared global state
Calling MCP tools directly without user_id parameter
Skipping user_id filter in database queries

faq.question: What is the difference between ChatKit and the OpenAI Assistants API?
faq.answer: ChatKit provides a complete frontend widget and protocol for real-time chat, while the Assistants API is only the backend. ChatKit includes conversation history management and a ready-to-use React component.

faq.question: How does user isolation work in ChatKit?
faq.answer: Three-level isolation: middleware extracts user_id from JWT, wrapper functions inject it into tool calls, database queries filter by user_id.

faq.question: Can I use this with databases other than PostgreSQL?
faq.answer: Yes. The patterns work with any database supported by SQLModel, including SQLite, MySQL, and PostgreSQL.

faq.question: Is ChatKit free to use?
faq.answer: ChatKit has usage-based pricing through OpenAI. Check the OpenAI platform for current rates.

faq.question: How do I debug ChatKit issues in production?
faq.answer: Enable DEBUG logging for chatkit.server and check for Authorization header issues. Use the verification checklist to test each isolation level.

faq.question: Can I customize the ChatKit widget appearance?
faq.answer: Yes. ChatKit supports theme configuration, custom headers, and event handlers. The widget is built on React and can be styled with CSS.
